title: Omix - Get started
text: goal Omix provide tools R build complete analysis workflow integrative analysis data generated multi-omics platform. Generate multi-omics object using MultiAssayExperiment. Quality control single-omics data. Formatting, normalisation, denoising single-omics data. Separate single-omics analyses. Integration multi-omics data combined analysis. Publication quality plots interactive analysis reports based shinyApp. Currently, Omix supports integration bulk transcriptomics bulk proteomics.

title: Omix - Get started
text: Omix pipeline requires following input: rawdata_rna: data-frame containing raw RNA count rownames gene colnames samples. rawdata_protein: data-frame containing protein abundance rownames proteins colnames samples. map_rna: data-frame two columns named primary colname primary contain unique sample name link sample metadata colname column names rawdata_rna data-frame. map_protein: data-frame two columns named primary colname primary contain unique sample name link sample metadata colname column names rawdata_protein data-frame. metadata_rna: data-frame containing rna assay specific metadata rownames colnames rawdata_rna data.frame. metadata_protein: data-frame containing protein assay specific metadata rownames colnames rawdata_protein data.frame. individual_metadata: data-frame containing individual level metadata omics assays. Call required packages vignette: First must load data Omix vignette: Sanity check
code: library(Omix) ## library(purrr) library(ggplot2) outputDir <- tempdir() rawdata_rna_fp <- file.path(outputDir, "raw_counts_MTG_CV.rds") rawdata_protein_fp <- file.path(outputDir, "raw_proteomics_MTG_CV.rds") map_rna_fp <- file.path(outputDir, "map_RNA_MTG_CV.rds") map_prot_fp <- file.path(outputDir, "map_prot_MTG_CV.rds") metadata_rna_fp <- file.path(outputDir, "metadata_rna_MTG_CV.rds") metadata_prot_fp <-  file.path(outputDir, "metadata_prot_MTG_CV.rds") individual_metadata_fp <-file.path(outputDir, "metadata_map_MTG_CV_new.rds") ctd_fp <-file.path(outputDir, "ctd.rds") ensembl_fp  <-file.path(outputDir, "ensembl.rds")  download.file(url = "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eleonore-schneeg/OmixData/main/data_MTG_CV/raw_counts_MTG_CV.rds",destfile=rawdata_rna_fp,headers = c(Authorization = paste("token", "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")))  download.file(url = "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eleonore-schneeg/OmixData/main/data_MTG_CV/raw_proteomics_MTG_CV.rds",destfile=rawdata_protein_fp,headers = c(Authorization = paste("token", "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")))  download.file(url = "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eleonore-schneeg/OmixData/main/data_MTG_CV/map_RNA_MTG_CV.rds",destfile=map_rna_fp ,headers = c(Authorization = paste("token", "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")))  download.file(url = "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eleonore-schneeg/OmixData/main/data_MTG_CV/map_prot_MTG_CV.rds",destfile=map_prot_fp ,headers = c(Authorization = paste("token", "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")))  download.file(url = "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eleonore-schneeg/OmixData/main/data_MTG_CV/metadata_rna_MTG_CV.rds",destfile=metadata_rna_fp ,headers = c(Authorization = paste("token", "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")))  download.file(url = "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eleonore-schneeg/OmixData/main/data_MTG_CV/metadata_prot_MTG_CV.rds",destfile=metadata_prot_fp ,headers = c(Authorization = paste("token", "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")))  download.file(url = "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eleonore-schneeg/OmixData/main/data_MTG_CV/metadata_map_MTG_CV_new.rds",destfile=individual_metadata_fp ,headers = c(Authorization = paste("token", "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")))   download.file(url = "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eleonore-schneeg/OmixData/main/ctd-2.rds",destfile=ctd_fp ,headers = c(Authorization = paste("token", "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")))  download.file(url = "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eleonore-schneeg/OmixData/main/ensembl_mappings_human.tsv",destfile=ensembl_fp ,headers = c(Authorization = paste("token", "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")))  rawdata_rna <- as.data.frame(readRDS(paste0(outputDir,'/raw_counts_MTG_CV.rds'))) rawdata_protein <- as.data.frame(readRDS(paste0(outputDir,'/raw_proteomics_MTG_CV.rds'))) map_rna <- as.data.frame(readRDS(paste0(outputDir,'/map_RNA_MTG_CV.rds'))) map_prot <- as.data.frame(readRDS(paste0(outputDir,'/map_prot_MTG_CV.rds'))) metadata_rna<- as.data.frame(readRDS(paste0(outputDir,'/metadata_rna_MTG_CV.rds'))) metadata_prot <-  as.data.frame(readRDS(paste0(outputDir,'/metadata_prot_MTG_CV.rds'))) individual_metadata <- as.data.frame(readRDS(paste0(outputDir,'/metadata_map_MTG_CV_new.rds'))) ctd <-  readRDS(paste0(outputDir,'/ctd.rds')) ensembl <-read.delim(file=paste0(outputDir,'/ensembl.rds'), sep = '\t', header = TRUE) rna_qc_data_matrix <- NULL all(rownames(metadata_rna) == colnames(rawdata_rna)) ## [1] TRUE all(rownames(metadata_prot) == colnames(rawdata_protein)) ## [1] TRUE

what: Step one - Generate a MultiAssayExperiment object
title: Omix - Get started
text: run Omix, first need generate multi-omics object package currently supports transcriptomics proteomics bulk data . MultiAssayExperiment object succesfully created. following steps process perform QC omic layers multiassay object.
code: # Convert metadata type from character to factor  individual_metadata$diagnosis <- factor(individual_metadata$diagnosis,                                         levels = c("Control", "AD")) individual_metadata$sex <- factor(individual_metadata$sex)  #Generate multiassay object multiomics_object_MTG=generate_multiassay(rawdata_rna =rawdata_rna,                                    rawdata_protein = rawdata_protein,                                    individual_to_sample=FALSE,                                    map_rna = map_rna,                                    map_protein = map_prot,                                    metadata_rna = metadata_rna,                                    metadata_protein = metadata_prot,                                    individual_metadata = individual_metadata,                                    map_by_column = 'sample_id',                                    rna_qc_data=FALSE,                                    rna_qc_data_matrix=NULL,                                    organism='human') ## ✔ Ensembl ID conversion to gene symbol ## ✔ Retrieval of gene biotype ## harmonizing input: ##   removing 58 sampleMap rows with 'colname' not in colnames of experiments ## ✔ RNA raw data loaded ## class: SummarizedExperiment  ## dim: 58884 29  ## metadata(1): metadata ## assays(1): rna_raw ## rownames(58884): ENSG00000223972 ENSG00000227232 ... ENSG00000277475 ##   ENSG00000268674 ## rowData names(3): ensembl_gene_id gene_name gene_biotype ## colnames(29): IGF117756 IGF117759 ... IGF117836 IGF117837 ## colData names(7): sample_id sample_name ... pct_pTau_Positive PHF1 ## ✔ Protein raw data loaded ## class: SummarizedExperiment  ## dim: 3228 39  ## metadata(1): metadata ## assays(1): protein_raw ## rownames(3228): ##   IGKV2-28;IGKV2-29;IGKV2-30;IGKV2-40;IGKV2D-26;IGKV2D-28;IGKV2D-29;IGKV2D-30;IGKV2D-40 ##   IGKV3-11;IGKV3D-11 ... Omix - Pseudotemporal multi-omics integration
text: goal Omix provide tools R build complete analysis workflow integrative analysis data generated multi-omics platform. Generate multi-omics object using MultiAssayExperiment. Quality control single-omics data. Formatting, normalisation, denoising single-omics data. Separate single-omics analyses. Integration multi-omics data combined analysis. Publication quality plots interactive analysis reports based shinyApp. Currently, Omix supports integration bulk transcriptomics bulk proteomics.

title: Omix - Pseudotemporal multi-omics integration

code: @Manual{,   title = {Omix: A Multi-Omics Integration Toolkit},   author = {Eleonore Schneegans and Nurun Fancy},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000}, }

title: A Multi-Omics Integration Toolkit
text: Omix pipeline provides generalisable framework can effectively process, visualise analyse patient-specific multi-omic data end--end manner. Omix built four consecutive blocks, summarised figure . Omix bioinformatics pipeline aims address important gaps related integration multi-omics data, namely enabling reproducibility integrative analyses providing grounds systematic benchmarking analyses. Pipeline outputs standardized include publication-quality plots, tables, interactive dashboards.

title: A Multi-Omics Integration Toolkit
text: can install development version Omix GitHub :

title: A Multi-Omics Integration Toolkit
text: Omix multimodal container harmonises data management multiple omics datasets. enables storage raw processed omics data slots, along patient metadata, technical metadata, analysis parameters outputs. object structure relies MultiAssayExperiment library omics layer processed separately according best practices. Given wide range processing functionalities, users decide parameters steps modular sequence performed, involves combination folllowing steps: Feature filtering Normalisation/ transformation Batch correction & denoising Sample outlier removal Formatting Omix provides suite analysis options including differential analysis (DE), standard method identify genes differentially expressed certain disease states; Weighted Gene correlation Network (WGCNA), identify modules genes associate certain disease covariates; sparse Partial Least Square (sPLS) define sparse set omics features, molecular signature, explains response variable. Omix provides series state---art integration models perform patient-specific multi-omic integration, including: MOFA Sparse Multi-Block PLS (sMB-PLS) DIABLO range multi-omics clustering models implemented MOVICS Multi-omics integration followed series downstream analyses, including: Multi-omics networks iGraph Community detection Louvain Leiden clustering algorithms Pseudotime inference Slingshot Functional enrichment EnrichR Cell-type enrichment EWCE Target validation based OpenTargets database Publication quality plots analysis reports Omix implements modular steps displays results interactive results dashboard. package functions designed interface neatly NextFlow scalable containerized pipelines deployed locally, high-performance computing clusters, cloud. See https://nf-co.re/omix accompanying NextFlow pipeline.

title: Get multi-omics comprehensive heatmap — getMoHeatmap
text: data list data frame matrix storing multiple omics data rows features columns samples. .binary logicial vector indicate subdata binary matrix 0 1 mutation. row.title string vector assign titles subdata. legend.name string vector assign legend title subdata. clust.res clust.res object returned getMOIC() one specified algorithm get\%algorithm_name\% getConsensusMOIC() list multiple algorithms. clust.dend dendrogram object returned returned getMOIC() one specified algorithm get\%algorithm_name\% getConsensusMOIC() list multiple algorithms. show.col.dend logical vector indicate showing dendrogram column top heatmap. show.colnames logical vector indicate showing names column bottom heatmap. show.row.dend logical vector indicate showing dendrogram row subdata. show.rownames logical vector indicate showing names row subdata. clust.dist.row string vector assign distance method clustering subdata feature dimension. clust.method.row string vector assign clustering method clustering subdata feature dimension. clust.col string vector storing colors annotating subtype top heatmap. color list string vectors storing colors subheatmap subdata. annCol data.frame storing annotation information samples exact sample order data parameter. annColors list string vectors colors matched annCol. annRow list string vectors indicate features belong subdata annotated specifically subheatmap. width integer value indicate width subheatmap unit cm. height integer value indicate height subheatmap unit cm. fig.path string value indicate output path storing comprehensive heatmap. fig.name string value indicate name comprehensive heatmap.
